description.narrative: Strengthened support to children, families and communities to promote nutritional practices and improve care including in humanitarian situations, which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened support to children, families and communities to promote nutritional practices and improve care including in humanitarian situations

description.narrative:
The intervention package to prevent chronic malnutrition is implemented in all the country's 17 health districts. The first round of the mass vitamin A and deworming campaign (June 2019) increased vitamin A coverage to 78%. Cooking demonstrations are implemented in 69 community villages and allow for transferring skills to families. A training guide for community health workers is available, incorporating a community nutrition component.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
